chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. PARTICIPATION AND SUCCESSFUL COMPLETTION OF TREATMENT COURT. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at the Courts discretion by petition from DOC. If probation would be revoked defendant is entitled to 22 days sentence credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes: Participate and successfully complete Door County Treatment Court.  No further law violations.

Discussion about the defendants week. 7 days of phase time imposed.
Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement

Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct.1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct.1. Counts 3-5 dismissed and read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. State/Defense give sentencing recommendation, make statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea. Defendant is accepting the States offer for a DJA for count 2. Court finds plea made freely,  knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, withholds acceptance of plea on Ct. 2. Court reviews conditions contained within DJA, approves DJA.  Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

10:00 AM Defendant Jaylen Joel Wilz in court, in custody.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Jaylen Joel Wilz.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 31, 2025 at 09:00 am.
